titleStmt.title: Nomo-lexikon, a law-dictionary interpreting such difficult and obscure words and terms as are found either in our common or statute, ancient or modern lawes : with references to the several statutes, records, registers, law-books, charters, ancient deeds, and manuscripts, wherein the words are used : and etymologies, where they properly occur / by Thomas Blount of the Inner Temple, Esq.
titleStmt.author: Blount, Thomas, 1618-1679.

titleStmt.title: Nomo-lexikon, a law-dictionary interpreting such difficult and obscure words and terms as are found either in our common or statute, ancient or modern lawes : with references to the several statutes, records, registers, law-books, charters, ancient deeds, and manuscripts, wherein the words are used : and etymologies, where they properly occur / by Thomas Blount of the Inner Temple, Esq.
titleStmt.author: Blount, Thomas, 1618-1679.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by Tho. Newcomb, for John Martin and Henry Herringman ...,

notesStmt.note: First two words of title transliterated from Greek.
Reproduction of original in Law School Library, Harvard University.
Pages at end are wrinkled in the filmed copy. Pages photographed from Newberry Library copy and inserted at the end.
